author: jhoneill
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
function test {
[cmdletbinding()]
param ($x) 
7
$x 
}
```

Test -  returns 
7
-

Test ---  returns 
7
---
but test -- returns 
7

-- is not acting as a decrement operator, not as a parameter named "-"  (test -a causes an error) nor as a value.  


# Expected behavior

```none
-- should either be passed as a value, or recognised as a (misplaced) operator, or treated as a parameter name. 
```

# Actual behavior

```none
-- appears to be ignored
```

# Environment data

```none
Applies on 5.1, 6.2 and 7 preview 6. Windows and 6.2 on WSL 
```

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body:
@jhoneill it's not ignored necessarily, it's a modifier.  When used, any parameters after it are treated like string input:

```powershell
Write-Output -- -Testing -These -Are -Strings
# -Testing
# -These
# -Are
# -Strings
```

So if you want to pass a literal `--` as a parameter you need to double up:

```powershell
Write-Output -- --
```
